alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Perry, southwestern Morgan and northwestern Athens Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1051 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nelsonville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Nelsonville, Glouster, Chesterhill, Chauncey, New Straitsville, Buchtel, Stockport, Jacksonville, Murray City, Trimble, Hemlock, Amesville, Stroud Run State Park, Burr Oak State Park and The Plains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
